title: Where is the counterplay to zed?
body:
I know the reason for the assassins update was to give more counterplay so Assassins won't one shot u without any chance to fight back, and I think this update just made alot of assassins useless. But again the assassins that were Already good Are now even stronger(khazix, rengar, zed...).
I mean if I'm playing an Adc how do I survive a zed ult he's just gonna delete me without anything for me to do . you may say that I shouldn't be walking the map alone but keep in your mind that I'm talking About a 5v5 situation with good vision And good map awareness . I mean he can just ult me and go back to his shadow and max out the damage with his shadows and I'm dead nothing I can do, unless I have both summoners up wich is not gonna keep me alive for 2 team fights when I need flash+heal in both of them.

replies.body:
Honestly with how strong support items are right now, Zed cant do anything to you in a team fight, unless of course he is fed.  Then again that's all assassins.   They are currently useless in team fights because of Exhaust/support items.  The only way Zed is getting the upper hand on you in a team fight is if your team just isn't paying attention.  Other than that there are the normal tips like building steraks/GA, just getting better at dodging in general, and positioning.  Even building an armor item wouldn't hurt, you need to understand if Zed fails his assassination he is useless for the rest of the team fight most of the time.  Surviving is your priority.  But if you are doing all of those things and Zed is somehow still killing you in a 5v5 you need to tell your team to keep their eyes on him. 

Remember Zed needs to be in melee range to get a kill with death mark, he cant simply swap to his shadow and maximize his damage.  Also Zed isn't strong, he is one of the weaker mid laners currently and he has been since he got the nerfs, he didn't even receive buffs in the update, it was just a pointless change.

aiming CC for where he lands after ult (directly behind you) and avoiding shurikens as  best you can manage

having an attentive support for shields and heals, or having exhaust up (you can take it yourself if you can convince them to take heal in your stead)
